Header.Description: JS06_Creating a JSON file & Inserting array elements using JSONInsert()

Text.val: Menu Object - first letter of the variable names defines if entry level is Menu ('M') or Child-menu ('C').
If a variable name starts with M, then it indicates a Menu object and if it starts with C,then it is a Child-menu object.
Value of variable - n=[Entry Display], u=[routing path], i=[coreUI icon name].
Order of variables should be same as the order of the menu.
This program currently considers the variables between "start menu data" and "end menu data".
If more menu items are needed, then the corresponding variables should be added below the 'H' variable ('M-Welcome2')
and expression #9 "LoopCounter()<='H'VAR-'D'VAR+1" should be modified by replacing 'H'VAR with the last variable reference,
which is used in Block condition "jsonBuild" event at line 25 in the logic tab.
####### start menu data #########
######## end menu data ########
##This program creates a json for the input provided in the form of name-value pair.
This input is parsed to get multiple json objects from it, which will later be inserted into the json array.
##Here, the variable names decide whether it is a Menu object or a Child-menu object.
If a variable name starts with M, then it indicates a Menu object and if it starts with C, then it is a Child-menu object.
##When new elements are to be added into a json array, then an empty object needs to be created before adding the actual value.
On similar lines, when a new json array needs to be created, then it should be created with [].
MAINLOOP: Parsing the variable name to identify whether it is a Menu object or a Child-menu object
and reading the variable value
Tokenizing the variable value into 3 components i.e. name, url, and icon
Creating an empty object into an array to add name,url, and icon
Updating the path on which a new element will be inserted
This Block is only applicable if variable name starts with 'C' and previousEntryType = 'M'
The following Block will insert a child item in the last menu item inserted
Creating an empty 'children' array inside last menu entry
Adding an empty object to the 'children' array
Inserting Menu/Child-menu element at a relevant position into the json array
Creating a json file using Blb2File function
The following function tokenizes the string based on the pKey provided and '='.
Viewing the JSON file
